snippet: In New York City apartment buildings where collective decision-making can cause months of tension, there is little that highlights the potential divide so clearly as choosing paintings for the lobby.
abstract: Elizabeth A Harris The Appraisal column notes that in New York City co-op and condominium buildings, where collective decision-making can cause months of tension, there is little that highlights the potential divide so clearly as choosing paintings for the lobby.
lead_paragraph: In New York City apartment buildings where collective decision-making can cause months of tension, there is little that highlights the potential divide so clearly as choosing paintings for the lobby.

headline.seo: In Apartment Lobbies, Overcoming Arguments Over Art
headline.main: Where Neighborly Agreement Is Scarce, Finding Consensus on Art in the Lobby
headline.print_headline: Where Neighborly Agreement Is Scarce, Finding Consensus on Art in the Lobby
